items.def: Romans 1-2 Corinthians Galatians Philippians 1 Thessalonians Philemon dated ~49-60 CE relevant because they are earliest Christian writings and confirm core claims within decades of the events

Ephesians Colossians 2 Thessalonians 1-2 Timothy Titus relevant because stylistic debates map to known ancient practices like use of secretaries while the letters preserve Pauline theology for churches
Composed ~65-70 CE relevant because it is likely the earliest Gospel and a source for Matthew and Luke which helps establish compositional order
Composed ~70-85 CE relevant because it addresses a Jewish audience and explicitly connects events to OT prophecy which reveals early fulfillment interpretation
Composed ~80-90 CE with a researched prologue in Luke 1:1-4 relevant because the two volume work situates the Jesus movement in first century Roman history
Composed ~90-95 CE with an eyewitness core indicated in John 21:24 relevant because it offers independent perspective and later theological reflection anchored to an identified witness
